meanings.definition: To walk or behave in a confident or arrogant manner.
meanings.sent1: He swanked around the playground, acting like he owned the place.
meanings.sent2: She swanked into the room, head held high and shoulders back.
meanings.sent3: The cat swanked along the fence, pretending to be the king of the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: The peacock swanked through the garden, displaying its colorful feathers proudly.
meanings.sent5: The bully swanked down the hallway, intimidating the other students with his swagger.

meanings.definition: To show off or boast about one's possessions or accomplishments.
meanings.sent1: They swanked their new car to everyone in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: He always swanked about his high grades in school.
meanings.sent3: The little girl swanked about her drawing skills, claiming she was the best artist in the class.
meanings.sent4: The rich businessman swanked his expensive watch, trying to impress his colleagues.
meanings.sent5: She swanked her latest promotion at work, making sure everyone knew about her success.
